poem:
Saturday Night Gesture

In the glow of studio lights,  
laughter finds its hesitant wings,  
sketches sketched in shadowed bravery.  
A city gasped, again,  
and a mayor with dusted shoulders  
said, "Why start now?"  
Yet, humor, that quiet boxer,  
stood again in the ring,  
ready to dance a cautious step,  
in the face of this shattered world.
